subsection_content:
Endometritis is an inflammation of the endometrial layer, usually caused by infection, such as interventional procedures in the uterine cavity that are not guaranteed to be sterile, such as abortion, implantation, etc. ring, removal, curettage biopsy... or retained placenta after cesarean section, prolonged uterine fluid retention... (1)
Doctor Hoang Manh Tung, Doctor at the Center for Obstetrics and Gynecology at Tam Anh General Hospital in Hanoi, said that endometritis is usually not life-threatening, it is important that women need to detect and treat the disease as much as possible. as soon as possible. Usually, the disease will be effectively treated with antibiotics.
